alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 1:08AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Mitchell County through 200 AM CDT... At 108 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tipton, or 15 miles southwest of Beloit, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Glen Elder around 120 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Beloit, Asherville, Simpson and Scottsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for north central Kansas.
